Class DHCPServer

java.lang.Object
Devices.Device
Devices.DHCPServer
public class DHCPServer extends Device
Represents a DHCP server in the network simulation Responsible for configuring IP pools, assigning IP addresses to devices, and managing the availability of IP addresses within defined pools.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

    • DHCPServer

      public DHCPServer(String name, String macAddress)
      Constructs a DHCPServer with the specified name and MAC address.
      Parameters:
      name - - the name of the DHCP server
      macAddress - - the MAC address of the server

  • Method Details

    • getTotalPorts

      public int getTotalPorts()
      Returns the number of ports on the DHCP server
      Overrides:
      getTotalPorts in class Device
      Returns:
      the number of total ports (always 1 for DHCP server)

    • configureIpPool

      public void configureIpPool(Scanner scanner)
      Allows user input to configure a new IP pool via the console Includes validation of sub-net and range values
      Parameters:
      scanner - - a Scanner instance to read user input

    • assignIp

      public String assignIp(String gatewayIP, String macAddress, Device device)
      Assigns an available IP address from IP pool based on gateway IP
      Parameters:
      gatewayIP - - the gateway IP identifying the IP pool
      macAddress - - the MAC address of the requesting device
      device - - the device to assign the IP to
      Returns:
      the assigned IP address, or null if unavailable

    • printPools

      public void printPools()
      Prints all configured IP pools and their available IPs

    • poolExists

      public boolean poolExists(String poolName)
      Checks whether a pool with the given name exists
      Parameters:
      poolName - - the name of the pool to check
      Returns:
      true if the pool exists, false otherwise

    • getPools

      public Map<String,IPPool> getPools()
      Returns the current map of all configured IP pools.
      Returns:
      map of gateway IPs to their IPPool objects
